result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Nicholas R. Mercier was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Nicholas R. Mercier was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Nicholas R. Mercier was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Ct.1 - Pay fine of $450.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Cts.2&3 - Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
Spend 120 days in the county jail, commencing 3/5/16 @ 8am.  Huber privileges are allowed.  Not eligible for electronic leg monitor.  Credit for 8 days served.  May not have contact with Dorothy Parker, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Pay prosecution costs in the amount of $140.00.

timeConds.notes: Huber and work crew privileges authorized.  Not eligible for electronic leg monitor.  Credit for 8 days served.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicholas R. Mercier, appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made and 14CF1308 & 15CF1082 read in.  Counts 1, 2, and 3 - Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 120 days in the KCJ commencing on 3/5/16 at 8:00 AM and DE is given credit for 8 days. Sentence is concurrent w/ 14CF929.  DE is not eligible for the Electronic Leg Monitor.  Huber & Work Crew is authorized.  As a condition he is ordered to pay prosecution costs in the amount of $140.  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.  In Count 1 Court imposes a fine of $450 plus costs and surcharges.  Cash Bond on Deposit between files 14CF1412, 14CF1308 and 15CF1082 are to be applied.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 16 months.  AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock ordered along with anger management.  No contact with Dorothy P. unless permitted by the court only.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
